exercise.description: Calculate the frequency of words given as input with Python.
exercise.tutorial:
Write a program to compute the frequency of the words from the input. The output should output after sorting the key alphanumerically.

Suppose the following input is supplied to the program:

"I am new to Python and I know there is Python 2 and Python 3. Should I choose Python 2 or Python 3?"

Output should be:

2:2

3:2

new:1

I:3

etc...

 

Email the Adelphi Training Team at adelphi-training-team@googlegroups.com for code review when you are finished. Use your n57 email address.

Input should be assumed to be console input.

question.text: Were you able to write this successfully in less than 10 lines of code?
